name: Beeswax
safety: Generally safe. Rare contact allergy possible.
sourcing_notes: Cosmetic-grade or food-grade. Yellow (unfiltered) retains some propolis and aroma. White (filtered) is neutral.

name: Shea Butter

salve_modifier.ratio: Replace up to 20-30% of carrier oil volume

lip_balm_modifier.ratio: 10-15% of total formulation, reduce beeswax slightly

safety: Generally safe. Derived from the nut of the shea tree (Vitellaria paradoxa). Those with severe tree nut allergies should exercise caution, though shea allergy is rare. Unrefined has a mild nutty scent.
sourcing_notes: Unrefined (Grade A) retains more healing compounds including triterpenes and cinnamic acid esters. Refined is odorless but lacks some bioactive compounds. Fair-trade sourcing supports West African women's cooperatives.
notes: Softens the texture of salves. Contains anti-inflammatory compounds (triterpene acetates). Melts at body temperature for excellent skin absorption. Reduces the amount of beeswax needed for a given consistency.
